segment.source: MMOS image definition
segment.target: MMOS image definition

segment.source: MMOS image definition
segment.target: MMOS image definition

segment.source: MMOS image definition
segment.target: MMOS image definition

segment.source: This section provides instructions for creating Windows 10 Mobile MMOS images.
segment.target: This section provides instructions for creating Windows 10 Mobile MMOS images.

segment.source: This process is similar to the process for creating the primary OS image.
segment.target: This process is similar to the process for creating the primary OS image.

segment.source: Creating an MMOS image
segment.target: Creating an MMOS image

segment.source: The MMOS image created during this process requires packages from the SoC manufacturer and the OEM in addition to those provided by Microsoft.
segment.target: The MMOS image created during this process requires packages from the SoC manufacturer and the OEM in addition to those provided by Microsoft.

segment.source: The OEM packages that are included in the sample MfgOEMInput.xml configuration file are for illustration purposes only.
segment.target: The OEM packages that are included in the sample MfgOEMInput.xml configuration file are for illustration purposes only.

segment.source: OEMs should remove those example packages and replace them with their own OEM packages.
segment.target: OEMs should remove those example packages and replace them with their own OEM packages.

segment.source: It is up to the OEM to determine which set to include in MMOS.
segment.target: It is up to the OEM to determine which set to include in MMOS.

segment.source: OEMs can add additional OEM packages containing test applications and test controllers, etc.
segment.target: OEMs can add additional OEM packages containing test applications and test controllers, etc.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: All the imaging and packaging tools are located in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386.
segment.target: All the imaging and packaging tools are located in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386.

segment.source: This path must be included in your environment Path for the tools to work.
segment.target: This path must be included in your environment Path for the tools to work.

segment.source: You must run these tools from a Visual Studio command-line window as an Administrator with access to MakeCat.exe in the environment path.
segment.target: You must run these tools from a Visual Studio command-line window as an Administrator with access to MakeCat.exe in the environment path.

segment.source: Creating OEM packages
segment.target: Creating OEM packages

segment.source: Adding content to an image is done by creating your own packages.
segment.target: Adding content to an image is done by creating your own packages.

segment.source: OEM packages can be added to an image by modifying the MfgOEMInput.xml file before creating an image with Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).
segment.target: OEM packages can be added to an image by modifying the MfgOEMInput.xml file before creating an image with Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).

segment.source: For instructions on creating packages, see Creating packages.
segment.target: For instructions on creating packages, see Creating packages.

segment.source: Specifying features in MMOS
segment.target: Specifying features in MMOS

segment.source: You can use the Feature element in the MfgOEMInput.xml file to include optional packages provided by Microsoft.
segment.target: You can use the Feature element in the MfgOEMInput.xml file to include optional packages provided by Microsoft.

segment.source: You can modify the input XML file to support different features in MMOS for development, manufacturing, and retail service needs.
segment.target: You can modify the input XML file to support different features in MMOS for development, manufacturing, and retail service needs.

segment.source: Manufacturing development and debugging environment
segment.target: Manufacturing development and debugging environment

segment.source: The following features are defined and supported in the manufacturing development and debugging environment.
segment.target: The following features are defined and supported in the manufacturing development and debugging environment.

segment.source: This environment can be used to create test applications for use in manufacturing.
segment.target: This environment can be used to create test applications for use in manufacturing.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The following features can only be used for test-signed packages and are not to be included in Customer Care WIM Images.
segment.target: The following features can only be used for test-signed packages and are not to be included in Customer Care WIM Images.

segment.source: General features
segment.target: General features

segment.source: Feature
segment.target: Feature

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: ENABLE_BOOT_KEYS_TEST
segment.target: ENABLE_BOOT_KEYS_TEST

segment.source: Enables a boot menu that is launched by pressing and holding the power button.
segment.target: Enables a boot menu that is launched by pressing and holding the power button.

segment.source: Use the Volume key to navigate and the Camera key to select.
segment.target: Use the Volume key to navigate and the Camera key to select.

segment.source: This feature is mutually exclusive with ENABLE_BOOT_KEYS_RETAIL.
segment.target: This feature is mutually exclusive with ENABLE_BOOT_KEYS_RETAIL.

segment.source: MOBILECOREBOOTSH
segment.target: MOBILECOREBOOTSH

segment.source: Enables the bootsh service (bootshscv) so that features in startup.bsc, such as telnet and ftp, can be used.
segment.target: Enables the bootsh service (bootshscv) so that features in startup.bsc, such as telnet and ftp, can be used.

segment.source: LABIMAGE
segment.target: LABIMAGE

segment.source: This feature causes the device to enter the FFU download mode automatically when the device is booted.
segment.target: This feature causes the device to enter the FFU download mode automatically when the device is booted.

segment.source: For more info, see Use the flashing tools provided by Microsoft.
segment.target: For more info, see Use the flashing tools provided by Microsoft.

segment.source: MFGTSHELL
segment.target: MFGTSHELL

segment.source: Enables TShell in MMOS and manufacturing mode.
segment.target: Enables TShell in MMOS and manufacturing mode.

segment.source: If you use this, you need to set the TestSirepServer service to auto in your manufacturing profile.
segment.target: If you use this, you need to set the TestSirepServer service to auto in your manufacturing profile.

segment.source: OPTIMIZED_BOOT
segment.target: OPTIMIZED_BOOT

segment.source: Modifies the behavior of the OS boot process to start some system processes and services before all device drivers are started.
segment.target: Modifies the behavior of the OS boot process to start some system processes and services before all device drivers are started.

segment.source: Enabling this feature may decrease boot time, but it may also cause regressions in boot behavior in some scenarios.
segment.target: Enabling this feature may decrease boot time, but it may also cause regressions in boot behavior in some scenarios.

segment.source: BOOTKEYACTIONS_RETAIL
segment.target: BOOTKEYACTIONS_RETAIL

segment.source: This feature enables a set of button actions for use in retail devices.
segment.target: This feature enables a set of button actions for use in retail devices.

segment.source: DISABLE_FFU_PLAT_ID_CHECK
segment.target: DISABLE_FFU_PLAT_ID_CHECK

segment.source: Disables the device platform validation in the Microsoft flashing application.
segment.target: Disables the device platform validation in the Microsoft flashing application.

segment.source: For more information about the platform check in flashing, see Use the flashing tools provided by Microsoft.
segment.target: For more information about the platform check in flashing, see Use the flashing tools provided by Microsoft.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The device platform validation for flashing must not be disabled in retail images.
segment.target: The device platform validation for flashing must not be disabled in retail images.

segment.source: PERF_TRACING_TOOLS
segment.target: PERF_TRACING_TOOLS

segment.source: Contains tools for doing performance analysis, such as tools for stopping and merging ETL tracing.
segment.target: Contains tools for doing performance analysis, such as tools for stopping and merging ETL tracing.

segment.source: ENABLE_BOOT_PERF_BASIC_TRACING
segment.target: ENABLE_BOOT_PERF_BASIC_TRACING

segment.source: Enables boot performance tracing events to be generated.
segment.target: Enables boot performance tracing events to be generated.

segment.source: ENABLE_BOOT_PERF_CPU_PROFILING_TRACING
segment.target: ENABLE_BOOT_PERF_CPU_PROFILING_TRACING

segment.source: Enables CPU profiling events on top of what ENABLE_BOOT_PERF_BASIC_TRACING enables.
segment.target: Enables CPU profiling events on top of what ENABLE_BOOT_PERF_BASIC_TRACING enables.

segment.source: Debug features
segment.target: Debug features

segment.source: Use the following settings to specify the transport that is used for debugging.
segment.target: Use the following settings to specify the transport that is used for debugging.

segment.source: If a debugging feature is not specified, debugging will not be enabled in MMOS.
segment.target: If a debugging feature is not specified, debugging will not be enabled in MMOS.

segment.source: Feature
segment.target: Feature

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: KDNETUSB_ON
segment.target: KDNETUSB_ON

segment.source: Includes all kernel debugger transports and enables KDNET over USB.
segment.target: Includes all kernel debugger transports and enables KDNET over USB.

segment.source: KDUSB_ON
segment.target: KDUSB_ON

segment.source: Includes all kernel debugger transports and enables KDUSB.
segment.target: Includes all kernel debugger transports and enables KDUSB.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Do not include either KDUSB_ON or KDNETUSB_ON if you need to enable MTP or IP over USB in the image.
segment.target: Do not include either KDUSB_ON or KDNETUSB_ON if you need to enable MTP or IP over USB in the image.

segment.source: If the kernel debugger is enabled in the image and the debug transports are used to connect to the phone, the kernel debugger has exclusive use of the USB port and prevents MTP and IP over USB from working.
segment.target: If the kernel debugger is enabled in the image and the debug transports are used to connect to the phone, the kernel debugger has exclusive use of the USB port and prevents MTP and IP over USB from working.

segment.source: KDSERIAL_ON
segment.target: KDSERIAL_ON

segment.source: Includes all kernel debugger transports and enables KDSERIAL with the following settings: 115200 Baud, 8 bit, no parity.
segment.target: Includes all kernel debugger transports and enables KDSERIAL with the following settings: 115200 Baud, 8 bit, no parity.

segment.source: KD
segment.target: KD

segment.source: Includes all kernel debugger transports in the image, but does not enable the kernel debugger.
segment.target: Includes all kernel debugger transports in the image, but does not enable the kernel debugger.

segment.source: MFGCRASHDUMPSUPPORT
segment.target: MFGCRASHDUMPSUPPORT

segment.source: This feature enables offline crash dump functionality by using the wpcrdmp method for MMOS images.
segment.target: This feature enables offline crash dump functionality by using the wpcrdmp method for MMOS images.

segment.source: When the device crashes, it activates wpcrdmp and saves a dump of the memory and SOC subsystems to the disk for an offline investigation.
segment.target: When the device crashes, it activates wpcrdmp and saves a dump of the memory and SOC subsystems to the disk for an offline investigation.

segment.source: MWDBGSRV
segment.target: MWDBGSRV

segment.source: This feature adds support for the user mode debug server.
segment.target: This feature adds support for the user mode debug server.

segment.source: The previous DEBUGGERON feature has been deprecated.
segment.target: The previous DEBUGGERON feature has been deprecated.

segment.source: Other debug features
segment.target: Other debug features

segment.source: Feature
segment.target: Feature

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Dumpsize setting features - The following three features must only be used with the Test and Health image types.
segment.target: Dumpsize setting features - The following three features must only be used with the Test and Health image types.

segment.source: These features must not be used with retail images.
segment.target: These features must not be used with retail images.

segment.source: Only one dumpsize setting can be selected at a time.
segment.target: Only one dumpsize setting can be selected at a time.

segment.source: DUMPSIZE512MB
segment.target: DUMPSIZE512MB

segment.source: Specifies a pre-allocated crash dump file size of 592 MB.
segment.target: Specifies a pre-allocated crash dump file size of 592 MB.

segment.source: This is intended for a phone with 512 MB of memory.
segment.target: This is intended for a phone with 512 MB of memory.

segment.source: DUMPSIZE1G
segment.target: DUMPSIZE1G

segment.source: Specifies a pre-allocated crash dump file size of 1104 MB.
segment.target: Specifies a pre-allocated crash dump file size of 1104 MB.

segment.source: This is intended for a phone with 1024 MB of memory.
segment.target: This is intended for a phone with 1024 MB of memory.

segment.source: DUMPSIZE2G
segment.target: DUMPSIZE2G

segment.source: Specifies a pre-allocated crash dump file size of 2128 MB.
segment.target: Specifies a pre-allocated crash dump file size of 2128 MB.

segment.source: This is intended for a phone with 2048 MB of memory.
segment.target: This is intended for a phone with 2048 MB of memory.

segment.source: Dump data storage location - The next two settings control if crash dump data is stored on eMMC or if crash dump data is stored on an SD card.
segment.target: Dump data storage location - The next two settings control if crash dump data is stored on eMMC or if crash dump data is stored on an SD card.

segment.source: Only one of these settings can be selected at a time.
segment.target: Only one of these settings can be selected at a time.

segment.source: These two features must only be used with the Test, Health and Selfhost image types.
segment.target: These two features must only be used with the Test, Health and Selfhost image types.

segment.source: These features must not be used with retail images.
segment.target: These features must not be used with retail images.

segment.source: DEDICATEDDUMPONEMMC
segment.target: DEDICATEDDUMPONEMMC

segment.source: Specifies that the DedicatedDumpFile location as c:\crashdump\dedicateddump.sys.
segment.target: Specifies that the DedicatedDumpFile location as c:\crashdump\dedicateddump.sys.

segment.source: Note This cannot be used with DEDICATEDDUMPONSDCARD.
segment.target: Note This cannot be used with DEDICATEDDUMPONSDCARD.

segment.source: DEDICATEDDUMPONSD
segment.target: DEDICATEDDUMPONSD

segment.source: DEDICATEDDUMPONSD – Specifies that the DedicatedDumpFile location as d:\dedicateddump.sys
segment.target: DEDICATEDDUMPONSD – Specifies that the DedicatedDumpFile location as d:\dedicateddump.sys

segment.source: When DEDICATEDDUMPONSD is used, crash dump will be disabled if the user removes the SD card or if the card is not present when the device booted.
segment.target: When DEDICATEDDUMPONSD is used, crash dump will be disabled if the user removes the SD card or if the card is not present when the device booted.

segment.source: To re-enable crash dump:
segment.target: To re-enable crash dump:

segment.source: Set this registry key to the value of
segment.target: Set this registry key to the value of

segment.source: Reboot the device.
segment.target: Reboot the device.

segment.source: Note This cannot be used with DEDICATEDDUMPONEEMC.
segment.target: Note This cannot be used with DEDICATEDDUMPONEEMC.

segment.source: DBGCHKDISABLE
segment.target: DBGCHKDISABLE

segment.source: This feature disables debugger connection checking and the debugger connection status is ignored.
segment.target: This feature disables debugger connection checking and the debugger connection status is ignored.

segment.source: The effect on the debugger behavior is different depending on the SoC that is being used.
segment.target: The effect on the debugger behavior is different depending on the SoC that is being used.

segment.source: For QC8x26 and QC8974 devices, include DBGCHKDISABLE to ensure that offline dumps will be generated even if the device is connected to a debugger.
segment.target: For QC8x26 and QC8974 devices, include DBGCHKDISABLE to ensure that offline dumps will be generated even if the device is connected to a debugger.

segment.source: Otherwise, an Offline Dump (Bug Check Code 0x14C dump) will not be created but a raw dump will still be created.
segment.target: Otherwise, an Offline Dump (Bug Check Code 0x14C dump) will not be created but a raw dump will still be created.

segment.source: For 8960 devices, include DBGCHKDISABLE to ensure that offline dumps will be generated even if the device is connected to a debugger.
segment.target: For 8960 devices, include DBGCHKDISABLE to ensure that offline dumps will be generated even if the device is connected to a debugger.

segment.source: Otherwise, an Offline Dump (i.e. Bug Check Code 0x14C dump) will not be created.
segment.target: Otherwise, an Offline Dump (i.e. Bug Check Code 0x14C dump) will not be created.

segment.source: MSVCRT_DEBUG
segment.target: MSVCRT_DEBUG

segment.source: This feature adds support for explicit linking of debug c-runtime libs by including msvcp120d.dll and msvcr120d.dll in the image.
segment.target: This feature adds support for explicit linking of debug c-runtime libs by including msvcp120d.dll and msvcr120d.dll in the image.

segment.source: For more information, see this topic on MSDN: CRT Library Features.
segment.target: For more information, see this topic on MSDN: CRT Library Features.

segment.source: MWDBGSRV
segment.target: MWDBGSRV

segment.source: This feature adds support for the user mode debug server.
segment.target: This feature adds support for the user mode debug server.

segment.source: NOLIVEDUMPS
segment.target: NOLIVEDUMPS

segment.source: Disables non-fatal kernel error reports.
segment.target: Disables non-fatal kernel error reports.

segment.source: These reports contain debugging information for OS and driver developers.
segment.target: These reports contain debugging information for OS and driver developers.

segment.source: TELEMETRYONSDCARD
segment.target: TELEMETRYONSDCARD

segment.source: This feature enables temporary storage of debugging logs and files on the SD card.
segment.target: This feature enables temporary storage of debugging logs and files on the SD card.

segment.source: This feature is only appropriate for test/self-host images and only on devices with less than 8 GB of free space of primary storage.
segment.target: This feature is only appropriate for test/self-host images and only on devices with less than 8 GB of free space of primary storage.

segment.source: Customer Care WIM Images
segment.target: Customer Care WIM Images

segment.source: The following features are supported in MMOS in the manufacturing production environment.
segment.target: The following features are supported in MMOS in the manufacturing production environment.

segment.source: Feature
segment.target: Feature

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: ENABLE_BOOT_KEYS_RETAIL
segment.target: ENABLE_BOOT_KEYS_RETAIL

segment.source: Enables a set of buttons on the phone for use in retail device.
segment.target: Enables a set of buttons on the phone for use in retail device.

segment.source: This feature is mutually exclusive with ENABLE_BOOT_KEYS_TEST (see the previous table).
segment.target: This feature is mutually exclusive with ENABLE_BOOT_KEYS_TEST (see the previous table).

segment.source: ENABLE_IP_OVER_USB
segment.target: ENABLE_IP_OVER_USB

segment.source: Enables IP Over USB.
segment.target: Enables IP Over USB.

segment.source: ENABLE_USB_COMPOSITE
segment.target: ENABLE_USB_COMPOSITE

segment.source: Enables the systems on a chip (SoC) provided composite USB stack in MMOS.
segment.target: Enables the systems on a chip (SoC) provided composite USB stack in MMOS.

segment.source: Dual use features
segment.target: Dual use features

segment.source: These MMOS features can be used with either test or retail customer care images.
segment.target: These MMOS features can be used with either test or retail customer care images.

segment.source: ENABLE_MMOS_CHARGING
segment.target: ENABLE_MMOS_CHARGING

segment.source: Enables battery charging when running in MMOS.
segment.target: Enables battery charging when running in MMOS.

segment.source: UEFI charging must be either disabled or enabled for MMOS to work.
segment.target: UEFI charging must be either disabled or enabled for MMOS to work.

segment.source: Only one of these options can be set at a time.
segment.target: Only one of these options can be set at a time.

segment.source: ENABLE_UEFI_CHARGING
segment.target: ENABLE_UEFI_CHARGING

segment.source: Enables battery charging when running in UEFI.
segment.target: Enables battery charging when running in UEFI.

segment.source: DISABLE_UEFI_CHARGING
segment.target: DISABLE_UEFI_CHARGING

segment.source: Disables battery charging when running in UEFI.
segment.target: Disables battery charging when running in UEFI.

segment.source: There are additional features that are defined in other image types of the operating system that are not supported in MMOS.
segment.target: There are additional features that are defined in other image types of the operating system that are not supported in MMOS.

segment.source: This list is not exhaustive, but it provides examples of features that are not supported in the manufacturing or retail environments:
segment.target: This list is not exhaustive, but it provides examples of features that are not supported in the manufacturing or retail environments:

segment.source: TESTINFRASTRUCTURE
segment.target: TESTINFRASTRUCTURE

segment.source: IMGFAKELED
segment.target: IMGFAKELED

segment.source: LABIMAGE
segment.target: LABIMAGE

segment.source: LOCATIONFRAMEWORKAPP
segment.target: LOCATIONFRAMEWORKAPP

segment.source: Configuring the MMOS MfgOEMInput.xml file
segment.target: Configuring the MMOS MfgOEMInput.xml file

segment.source: Open the sample MfgOEMInput.xml file using a text editor.
segment.target: Open the sample MfgOEMInput.xml file using a text editor.

segment.source: By default, this file is installed to %WPDKCONTENTROOT%OEMInputSamples8960Fluid.
segment.target: By default, this file is installed to %WPDKCONTENTROOT%OEMInputSamples8960Fluid.

segment.source: Add needed MMOS features as described previously.
segment.target: Add needed MMOS features as described previously.

segment.source: Add any required OEM packages to the file.
segment.target: Add any required OEM packages to the file.

segment.source: Locate the Product element and confirm that it is set to "".
segment.target: Locate the Product element and confirm that it is set to "".

segment.source: You can optionally update the description to record information about the OS image.
segment.target: You can optionally update the description to record information about the OS image.

segment.source: Locate the SOC and Device elements and change them as necessary.
segment.target: Locate the SOC and Device elements and change them as necessary.

segment.source: Add %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386 to your environment Path variable.
segment.target: Add %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386 to your environment Path variable.
